questDatabase.name: Your first night
questDatabase.description: You first task will be to find food and a shelter for the night. The nights will be cruelsome, as this pack has HardcoreDarkness. It probably would be a good idea to collect some food now...

questDatabase.name: Where is the flint?
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, while collecting gravel, no flint dropped for you. Well, there is an ap.. recipe for that. Look up flint in NEI and craft some!

questDatabase.name: Sticks 'n Stones
questDatabase.description: This book has a built-in reading light, lucky you! Most probably you'd be reading this text while you are waiting for the night to be over. Once it is, go out and collect some gravel and wood. Keep in mind that you need food, so look for Pam's Harvestcraft gardens. (Don't forget to save some vegetables for their seeds!)

questDatabase.name: Crafting time!
questDatabase.description: Yeah, you guessed it right. It's time to get the 3x3 table. Grab some flint and some wood, and build one!

questDatabase.name: Storage for days
questDatabase.description: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting, it's about time to make some storage for your goods. Take some of your wood, and craft a chest. You will need 4 wood logs, 4 planks and a flint

questDatabase.name: Tools
questDatabase.description: Now that you've got a shelter, crafting table and a place to store your items, you should make some tools. (Except if you'd like to become a professional tree puncher...)

questDatabase.name: You reap...
questDatabase.description: You won't always get food rewards from this book, so it might be a good idea to take care of that problem. As you've created a hoe already, go and find some water nearby and make a field. Let's trade some sticks for a carrot, so you can start your farm.

questDatabase.name: ...what you sow
questDatabase.description: If you, by chance, did read the previous quest and planted the carrot I gave you, then you're fine. Meanwhile, you should turn some more fruits and vegetables into seeds, and increase your farm to get a steady supply of food

questDatabase.name: Get that stone
questDatabase.description: Look at you, with your shiny flint pickaxe! Time to mine some cobblestone. Yay! (And maybe you can improve this dirt-hut to...)

questDatabase.name: Fire, fire, Grandpa!
questDatabase.description: Time to burn some stuffs, isn't it? You can't make charcoal in it, but you sure will find some usage for it soon

questDatabase.name: Rest in pieces
questDatabase.description: It's GLOPPing time! Go kill some pigs to gather meat. (And yes, they will drop cooked porkchop. Now if that isn't useful..)

questDatabase.name: Sharpness: Over.. 5..
questDatabase.description: It's about time to craft some more usefull thing: A sword!

questDatabase.name: Fluffy and red
questDatabase.description: Epic quest: Kill some sheep! (And try to find some wool, for a bed, obviously)

questDatabase.name: SO..TIRED..MUST..SLEEP..
questDatabase.description: Tiring day, hasn't it been? And with this, we conclude Tier 0. Congratulations, you've built yourself your first hideout, and you should have a steady supply of food by now. See you again in Tier 1!

questDatabase.name: What is ..that...? o.O
questDatabase.description: You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that really look special. You are sure that these trees are more than just wood to build your home or get charcoal

questDatabase.name: Ready, set, go!
questDatabase.description: You probably would be having a home by now. A steady supply of food is a fundamental requirement all the time. Take this journal to keep track of the things you've eaten while you proceed. You will have to travel far in this Tier, better be prepared!

questDatabase.name: Better Tank...... Iron Tank
questDatabase.description:
Store more than 16 Buckets of Fluids in one tank? Sure! Make some iron Tank or upgrade the Buildcraft Tank.
Diamond Tanks carry up to 64 Buckets and Obsidian ones are blast proof.

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Sand
questDatabase.description: In a strange 'vision' you saw a big structure which would allow you to make charcoal. Finally some torches! According to your calculations, you would need a lot of sand for that

questDatabase.name: Basic processing
questDatabase.description: Most things are unavailable at the moment, so let's begin with something simple. Take some of your cobblestone and smelt it into regular stone. Fret not, because you can use wood for it. Now, how much fun is that!

questDatabase.name: Macerator v0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: This fancy little device works (almost..) like a macerator. Some people say it's even better, since it does not require power, yay! You only need to craft one for this quest, but you probably should make some more if you can...

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Gravel
questDatabase.description: While collecting resources, your tools will loose durability. You think it would be a good idea to collect more gravel in order to provide yourself with flint for more tools

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Clay
questDatabase.description: You're bored digging for gravel, right? What better idea to kill your time, than with pottery?! You should go and find some clay

questDatabase.name: Finite Water..?
questDatabase.description: Finite Water is a problem, that's for sure. But last night, you had an idea. If you can drink cacti, you should also be able to use it for most recipes that require water. How cool is that? So what about another trade; 10 Wood for.. say, uh.. 3 Cacti so you can setup a farm. Deal?

questDatabase.name: Something to carry liquids
questDatabase.description: You tried to move water with you bare hands, which didn't work at all. Luckily, you stumble on a long lost recipe showing how the ancient man made buckets... with clay, of course

questDatabase.name: Char.Coal... Whatever
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself some charcoal. For that, we're going to build a coke oven. Good that you just collected a lot of resources!

questDatabase.name: Another brick in the wall
questDatabase.description: Your vision becomes more clear, you'll need bricks for your first multiblock structure. You think that 104 Bricks will be enough. However, the bricks you'll need are somewhat special. Pay attention to craft the correct ones!

questDatabase.name: Forming press v0.1
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, you cannot turn clay into bricks as usual. Well, to be fair, it wasn't a good recipe anyways. You'll probably end up with something bread-shaped. So in order to make bricks, you need a form. Get yourself a knife and a blank pattern, and cut a brick sized piece out. Boy! Isn't this a 'sharp' idea?!

questDatabase.name: 'Power'ful finally!
questDatabase.description: Now that you've unlocked your coke oven, you should start producing charcoal. The more, the better. Don't worry about the creosote oil; I assure you, it would come in handy...

questDatabase.name: Time to play 'Mine'craft
questDatabase.description: With your newly acquired fuel source, you are now ready to process more advanced materials than stone or clay; Iron or copper, for example. Just in care you didn't already know, they spawn in rather large veins. Use the following quests to search and locate the most important veins you'll need

questDatabase.name: Another fuel source
questDatabase.description: Lignite and regular coal is the fuel source you'll definitely need; as the latter can be turned into coke, which is a superior than coal to... well, you know this already...

questDatabase.name: Cu Copper
questDatabase.description: Can be found either between y 10 and 40 as "Malachite Ore", or between 5 and 60 as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the times you'll find it together with forms of Iron, such as Yellow/Brown Limonite

questDatabase.name: Tin for the win!
questDatabase.description: Found mostly in Mountains, between y 60 and 220. Don't let their sister ores called Cassiterite deceive you!

questDatabase.name: Bookparts
questDatabase.description: After you found a way to pickup and move around water, you had another brilliant idea: Paper! Usually made with Sugarcane, which doesn't work anymore (And is pretty weird anyways..). However, you will need a lot of wood to craft some usable wood pulp (at least for now), so better grab your Axe and go choppin' some trees

questDatabase.name: Time to Tinker
questDatabase.description: While using your flint-tools is fun in terms of burning pigs and cows, let's admit it: they are not really good, and can't be repaired. You've had an idea on how to craft tools that could be repaired and upgraded, but for that you'll definitely need some more advanced crafting tables

questDatabase.name: Aluminini...yum...?
questDatabase.description: Howsoever it is spelled, you will need it. Mostly found on the surface. Try to search in rivers (This quest is optional)... Oh! And don't confuse it with the GregTech Al that you'll need later, but won't be able to use this one for!

questDatabase.name: Ounce of brounze
questDatabase.description: Now that you've found copper and tin, you should make yourself some bronze. Use your mace... mortar to grind some copper and tin, and mix them together! The ratio remains the same, but you'll be surprised by the output... at least for now...

questDatabase.name: Time to be a..uh craft some tools
questDatabase.description: In order to craft even the most basic machines, you'll need new tools. Most of them can be replaced by machines later, but for now, you should make yourself familar with each of their recipes, as you will need a lot of them starting today

questDatabase.name: Getting iron
questDatabase.description: With your new bronze tools, you are able to mine another "primal" ore: Iron. There are other iron compounds you can mine earlier, like pyrite. But iron itself, can only be mined with a bronze tool or better

questDatabase.name: Upgrading your tool
questDatabase.description: With Aluminum and Copper, you can create a pretty durable material, which can be used to cast better (And repairable!) tools. These can be used to mine some more advanced ores like... well, you'd rather start using WAILA now if yo haven't been lately!

questDatabase.name: Stooooorrrraage
questDatabase.description: As crafting chests is a good idea for your basic items and goods, it is not ideal for the vast amount of ores. You should probably build yourself some barrels in order to keep things organized

questDatabase.name: Marching towards machines!
questDatabase.description: As you've gathered and crafted all materials and tools you need for your basic steam machinery, you may now proceed to the next tier. Keep in mind that you'll need tonnes of resources in order to craft even the simplest things, so you probably should stock up on all ores in this tier. But of course again, that is up to you

questDatabase.name: BurnS, baby, burnS!
questDatabase.description: You decided it's time to bake some tasty pizza, but your fingers got burned badly. Reading an ancient cookbook, you discover a magical item that would allow you to carry anything hot, even lava in a bucket! What a hot idea!

questDatabase.name: Bacon hunter
questDatabase.description: Previously, you killed some Pigs and Sheep to complete quests. You must be wondering where are the cows, right? NOW is the time to kill some Cows and hopefully get some leather. If you are lucky and get some Cow Trophy you'd never need to kill any 'holy' cows in the future.

questDatabase.name: Strings, cotton and wool
questDatabase.description: You find out that Cotton is very useful. You can make wool out of it (how you can do this this very magical) Strings can made out of Cotton too and some other useful items. Make some small Cotton plantation to get more of this useful stuff. There are Pam's cotton textiles to help as well

questDatabase.name: Well, done, well-done and well done!
questDatabase.description: Also, welcome! This tier is all about your first machines, getting twice the amount of ingots from your ores (yeah! SO relieving, isn't it?) and making particularly bronze more efficiently than you ever did before

questDatabase.name: Tankful you would be!
questDatabase.description: 576 Buckets of Fluids...... (Hopefully) Enough to store all the yellow fluid (creosote) that you made hitherto. The smallest Tank is a 3x4, the largest, 9x8 blocks. Well, if this isn't big enough,...

questDatabase.name: Advanced alloy upgrade
questDatabase.description: Your smeltery does a great job in mixing metals to alloys, but it's not very efficient, and has other drawbacks (lava, speed,...). You need something better, so why not put your steam to use?

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: High speed alloys
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. Like most machines, there is a more advanced version of the alloy smelter. Keep in mind that this machine uses a lot of steam, so you better get some more boilers first

questDatabase.name: A very important all(o)y
questDatabase.description: Basically the most important alloy (until you reach a higher tier) is without questioning, red alloy. Fortunately, you have an alloy smelter, so better grab some redstone and get yourself a handful of that.

questDatabase.name: The heck is that?
questDatabase.description: Getting comfortable with machines, aren't we? Well, in order to get more machines, you'll need pistons. But not those amateurishly ones - you need special ones, and I shall guide you how to make those

questDatabase.name: From mace to macerator v1.0!
questDatabase.description: Finally you are able to get a device, that will relieve you of your grind. However, the "no-durability" feature of this device comes with a cost: You need 2 diamonds and of course, steam for the grinding heads

questDatabase.name: Extracting... and exacting?
questDatabase.description: As you'll need rubber sheets later on in order to wrap wires into cables, you should get yourself a steam extractor. You can also use this machine to get more dyes from flowers, or process different fruits into juice

questDatabase.name: A clear view
questDatabase.description: Still living in your dirt/cobblestone bunker? What about some windows? Put some sand in your smeltery, and pour it into a casting basin to make clear glass. In order to use it for recipes, you have to macerate it up and smelt it in any furnace

questDatabase.name: And here falls the hammer!
questDatabase.description: No, it's not about the ban hammer. Using 6 ingots to craft a hammer seems to be pretty wasteful, as these tools use up durability. How nice would it be to have a machine that does the same but without taking durability damage? Guess what? There indeed is one! And you should totally get it!

questDatabase.name: Compressing stfs
questDatabase.description: This rather simple device does a very important job: Compressing things. As you are not able to get blocks just by pressing 9 ingots with your bare hands, it is also usefull to do various additional tasks, for example making tofu

questDatabase.name: Upgrade unlocked: Better compressor
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam compressor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast

questDatabase.name: New Upgrade: Forge hammer
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam forge hammer. Uses more steam, but again, is almost twice as fast

questDatabase.name: Extract an extractor upgrade
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam extractor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. You most probably want to craft this, as the normal extractor does also extract your nerves...

questDatabase.name: Raining Upgrades: Better macerator
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. Other machines' counterpart... Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast.

questDatabase.name: Alternative steam?!
questDatabase.description: There is more than one way to get steam for your machines. This completely optional quests shall show you some ways to get steam for your steam age

questDatabase.name: Upgrade continues: Coal boiler
questDatabase.description: This is basically just an upgrade to your current coal boiler, however it produces more than twice as much steam. Something you should consider building if you're planning to get some of the machines upgrades

questDatabase.name: A steamy idea!
questDatabase.description: With the more durable steel casings, you can now even use lava to make steam

questDatabase.name: Apollo's blessings...
questDatabase.description: The sun packs in quite a bit of power, so why not use it to produce (almost) free steam?

questDatabase.name: Steamed momos?
questDatabase.description: Although it is more efficient than using a regular furnace, don't wait for it if you are famishing!

questDatabase.name: Upgrades yet again: Better furnace
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam furnace. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast.

questDatabase.name: Blast-off!
questDatabase.description: It's about time to make some steel. Look in the Multiblock-QuestSet and build a bronze blast furnace. Come back with at least 8 such ingots

questDatabase.name: Next upgrade: TIER Upgrade!
questDatabase.description: Guess who just levelled up! You are now able to make better machines! Congratulations! Although it is of another matter that now you'll have to craft even more things before you can begin. But fear not mortal, I shall guide you!

questDatabase.name: Wirings & Hooking up!
questDatabase.description: One of the very basic materials which you should probably memorize how to craft, are wires and cables. Basically you just cut a plate into a wire with your wire cutter. Not very efficient, but there will be a better way later

questDatabase.name: The logic of logic circuits
questDatabase.description: Where steam machines are kinda stupid and just do one thing again and again, as you advance into electrical age, you've decided that you want the machines to have more features, like auto-output in order to create some automation. For that, you need logic circuits

questDatabase.name: Electrocution insurance
questDatabase.description: Placing wires without insulation seems to be a bad idea. Now that you have an extractor to extract rubber pulp out of sticky resin, you should process this pulp into sheets

questDatabase.name: Steam-a-licious!
questDatabase.description: Stay strong! You're almost there! One last crafting step; and you can advance to Tier 2. Keep going!

questDatabase.name: Mean Rotors and Wretched Motors
questDatabase.description: Motors are little devices that can turn electical power into rotational energy. Very usefull for all kind of machines, and not THAT difficult to craft. The pattern is always the same, only the materials change with a higher tier. Oh! If only you had some earpads...

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Rotors
questDatabase.description: Rotors are also always crafted in an identical pattern. A bit annoying to craft at the moment, but you don't need a lot of them... well, at least not for now, anyways...

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Casings
questDatabase.description: All machines need a hull to keep their 'private parts' hidden and together. Good news is: They are crafted in the same way for every tier. Only the materials change with every progression

questDatabase.name: Can you smell...t that?
questDatabase.description: It's time for something really big: A smeltery! It takes a lot to craft, so better gather some resources...

questDatabase.name: The water problem
questDatabase.description: Finite water is a problem. Agreed. Now stop your rants! There ARE solutions! I shall guide you to one of them... It's a... uh.. slow but steady supply of water

questDatabase.name: Feel the steel!
questDatabase.description: You need steel? Fine. Let's get busy...

questDatabase.name: EBFT - No, nothing German. It's EBF Time!
questDatabase.description: In order to get alumin(i)um, you shall need an electrical blast furnace. It's another very important step towards the pinnacle, so let's get started

questDatabase.name: Upgrade unlocked: Stoke up the heat!
questDatabase.description: Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. You can even recycle the old coils! How fancy is that!

questDatabase.name: Upgrade unlocked: Higher tier
questDatabase.description: To reach the 3600k heat capacity of your EBF, so you can process high-tier materials like Tungsten, you need Nichrome heating coils

questDatabase.name: Compress evrythng!
questDatabase.description: Martin's favourite machine. Compress ALL the things! With explosives, of course.

questDatabase.name: In the name of universe ...
questDatabase.description: ...there's only one absolute... everything freezes! Now it's somewhat expensive to launch into space just to cool down a few ingots, so why not build a machine which can simulate the cold environment?

questDatabase.name: 'Dream'-come-true?
questDatabase.description: Because we're nice Developers, we decided to throw in a little bonus if you happen to compress charcoal. Not only enables it to process more than 16 steel at a time, it also yields 10x the burn time per block instead of 9x. So one charcoal for free. This bonus only occurs on the first compression step. (But for fanciness, you should definitely get a Quintuple one!)

questDatabase.name: Charcoal v10.0
questDatabase.description: Sure, those Coke-Ovens are nice, but there aren't even remotely fast enough to keep up with a large steam boiler. Luckily , there is an upgrade available! The produced creosote oil is consumed instead of returned; But it will speed up the process dramatically. Who still needs those tonnes of torches anyways... Wait. TORCHES? You exclaim. Yes. Perhaps there is still some time to exploit the NEI!

questDatabase.name: Tank you!
questDatabase.description: With your brand new Alloy Smelter, you are able to .. well... create alloys of course. What would happen if you mixed some Obsidian Dust and Glass? Obsidian Glass? Great! Your fist tank would be this spiffy Buildcraft Tank. This tank can carry up to 16 buckets of any fluid. You're sure it'd be possible to upgrade those tanks sooner or later...

questDatabase.name: Smelt your world...
questDatabase.description: ...at once! Well, not quite literally... This beast here uses power to smelt up to 18 items in one step. Can't go any faster, or can you? (Well, maybe with those fancy new LuV+ Tier machines in this pack...)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade unlocked: Highest Tier-onium
questDatabase.description: To process Draconium and Neutronium you need more than 3600K. Upgrade your EBF to 9000K.

questDatabase.name: Eureka!
questDatabase.description: With due progression, you've had an epiphany! What if you made a steel tank? It should be able to give you more storage, considering steel is a tier higher! All sizes allowed from 3x4 to 9x8 Blocks.

questDatabase.name: 'It's a very long way home'
questDatabase.description: Why, hello there! Seems you've made it into electrical age. But behold, do not throw your steam machines away, you'll probably want to use them until you reach Tier 3, thereafter which you'd still want to be considerate for the environment and may want to recycle them (wink wink, nudge nudge)

questDatabase.name: 3, is a magical number
questDatabase.description: In Tier 3, you will be able to craft your first actually "useful" machines. Basic ones do the job, but with MV, a lot more recipes unlock. Your goal here is to reach a stable ore-processing for the vast amounts of materials you'll need for Tier 4. You also should focus on power production if you haven't already.

questDatabase.name: Dam you, wirecutter!
questDatabase.description: Enough is enough. No more wasting of gazillion of time and hardwork just for a couple of wires. Now that you have power, you should go for a wiremill!

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate it...
questDatabase.description: The first item you'll need a lot of. If you want to pull items out of Chests or Barrels you need one.

questDatabase.name: ...and probably this as well...
questDatabase.description: The second item you'll need a lot of. When you want to get the fluid out of the tanks, you'd surely need one.

questDatabase.name: Well, stay strong and keep going!
questDatabase.description: The third item you'll need a lot of, and is also a pain to craft. Probably, the most painful item ever...

questDatabase.name: Macerrrrrrratorrrr
questDatabase.description: It is highly recommended to get one of these electric macerators, as its efficiency in terms of steam generated/fuel usage to macerate something is a lot better!

questDatabase.name: I understand your pain...
questDatabase.description: A piston, but more .. "Electrical". The 4th item you gonna craft a lot in the future

questDatabase.name: Saving Pvt. Redstone
questDatabase.description: Tired of using 4 redstone for one magnetic rod? Well, good news for you! The polarizer doesn't need redstone, just a little bit of power. You don't need to attach this machine to a permanent power source, it runs fine on batteries

questDatabase.name: Avengers, assemble!
questDatabase.description: An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course.

questDatabase.name: The key to success? Savings!
questDatabase.description: Why wasting a full ingot to make a rod, that needs a tool which looses durability and takes even more ingots? With just this little device, all your rod-needs shall be fulfilled (for now)

questDatabase.name: Bzzzzzzzz
questDatabase.description: Optional machine. Like the forming press, you don't really *need* it in the 32 EU/tick age. Not mandatory to proceed

questDatabase.name: A pressing need
questDatabase.description: An optional machine, if you want to make circuits more efficiently. Not mandatory in 32 EU/tick age, so if you're short on steel, you can skip this device and build it in the next tier

questDatabase.name: Electrifying hammer!
questDatabase.description: Not really required, but it is a lot faster than the steam one. Oh! And it can be automated. What you can do with it, is something that we leave it to your imagination...

questDatabase.name: Cutting things apart
questDatabase.description: A mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, and that with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it!

questDatabase.name: Inching towards Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed forward, you need to get Aluminium. A lot of it at that. But for now, one is enough to unlock this quest. Probably the best source for Aluminium is clay, but you'd need an MV machine for that. So you need to find an alternative until you have enough dusts for your first machine

questDatabase.name: Abracadabra!
questDatabase.description: Now that you are able to produce Aluminium, you may dig into magic. If you haven't unlocked basic thaumaturgy yet, hunt for a silverwood and a greatwood tree

questDatabase.name: The missing one
questDatabase.description: <basdxz> But ffs, add a plate bender to the LV tier book

questDatabase.name: Auto-bang-mation!
questDatabase.description: Well, probably not the first, but definitely something big! First you need a cart assembler

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Power
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered by solar and lava; But for now you have to use a simple coal engine

questDatabase.name: (un)loading automation
questDatabase.description: You can fill and empty your cart manually, but it's a lot more convenient to automate that; Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Farming
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, the basic farmer can't farm anything besides wheat; But it's not expensive at all, and probably the cheapest solution to give your automated food production a boost

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Storage
questDatabase.description: A basic cart can't hold any items, so you think maybe attaching chests to it would work...

questDatabase.name: Missing something?
questDatabase.description: In order to create or customize your cart you need a hull to attach your desired updates to. Wood can be used for really simple item transfer, but to farm wheat or wood, you need at least an iron one

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Wood cutter
questDatabase.description: The basic wood cutter will break after a while, but you never have to replace it. It can be simply repaired with Diamonds

questDatabase.name: Basic telep..eh transport pipe
questDatabase.description: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own; But in combination with Transfer Nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are. Also, given the correct updates, they even surpass most other transfer systems

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Items
questDatabase.description: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Fluids
questDatabase.description: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer.. liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!

questDatabase.name: Can you can 'em?
questDatabase.description: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why not do something against that? A watering can will come in handy very soon

questDatabase.name: Gotta catch 'em all
questDatabase.description: Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is perhaps a mcuh better solution for that

questDatabase.name: Mon mon-ster protection (You see, we devs know a bit of French, too!)
questDatabase.description: Spawning monsters in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get a silverfish creeper. Luckily, there is a way to prevent them to spawn at all

questDatabase.name: A unique, yet not so unique storage
questDatabase.description: Barrels are pathetic, and normal chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and / or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type

questDatabase.name: Turrect your base; Tier 1
questDatabase.description: One needs proper protection for his home. So why not get some turrets for safety? At the moment, 2 Turrets are available; "Potato" and "disposable item". I assume you can guess what they do and how they work...

questDatabase.name: Passive defense
questDatabase.description: A more "passive" approach to base defense are walls and fences. But seriously, like, why'd you be playing this pack if you wanted something so mundane??

questDatabase.name: Pew pew pew!
questDatabase.description: Turrets must be placed on top of a turret base. Only the player who initially played the base can access and configure the turret; So don't worry about people taking your ammunition

questDatabase.name: Who needs that dirt anyways?
questDatabase.description: You probably have a ton of items floating around in your base; So why not use it to kill enemies?

questDatabase.name: Don't play with food!
questDatabase.description: Use it to kill Zombies instead. Does only little damage, but hey, something is better than nothing, right?

questDatabase.name: IEDs!
questDatabase.description: Your turrets probably need more space to hold more ammunition, so why not get an upgrade for that? It'd make your turrets 'improved', they're 'devices' and they contain 'explosives' so you think this name indeed fits well!

questDatabase.name: Electrolyzing all the things
questDatabase.description: You must have collected a lot of Dusts since you started macerating, washing and centrifuge Ores. Until now you couldn't have seperated it at all. But it's done now! Now it's time to get all the pure and valuable Materials out of the Dusts.

questDatabase.name: Yet another storage problem...
questDatabase.description: Having tons of chests everywhere can get quite annoying after a while. Getting an AE System is not an option either, as you don't have access to the required materials yet. But there is an early solution for that problem

questDatabase.name: End-er IO? Rather call it Start-er IO
questDatabase.description: You've probably used EnderIO before. It's quite useful for a lot of things. But a lot of stuffs have changed here, so let's start from scratch!

questDatabase.name: Machine chassis
questDatabase.description: All EnderIO machines still require the basic chassis, and have 'almost' the same recipe as before; Except that you need plates instead of ingots. But at this stage, that should hardly be a problem, if at all...

questDatabase.name: Here a tank, there a tank!
questDatabase.description: Until now, you were required to use buildcraft tanks to carry liquids around; Which could and most probably, would've been a pain to do. These little tanks are able to push and pull liquids by themselfs, as they have a buildin pump which is powered by some magic energy source. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Convenient conventional energy...
questDatabase.description: By simply burning coal as fuel, this machine produces RF power. Not a lot, but enough for a basic machine setup

questDatabase.name: Black diamond!
questDatabase.description: This generator requires both water as coolant, and a burnable liquid; Such as fuel. The amount of power it produces depends on the liquid used

questDatabase.name: The power of ender'men'
questDatabase.description: Elevators are nice, but they are limited to vertical teleportation, and their range also is somewhat limited. TravelAnchors do not have that limitation; You can teleport from one Anchor to any other within range; You can name them and even set them to private.

questDatabase.name: Conduits... Sounds familiar, doesn't it?
questDatabase.description: Probably the most awesome way to transport just anything in multiple different ways. Get some of each type

questDatabase.name: YETAnother wrench
questDatabase.description: The Yeta Wrench is more than just a regular wrench; While holding it, you are able to switch between available conduits, eventually allowing you remove one specific conduit type from a bundle of many. Ctrl-Mousewheel will switch modes; Also Shift-Leftclick allows you to open the configuration interface even if you don't have access to that side of the conduit

questDatabase.name: Conduit Upgrades!
questDatabase.description: Conduits on their own are pretty awesome, but you can do better. By using filters and speed upgrades, you gain even more control over what and how fast they work

questDatabase.name: Making things aesthetic
questDatabase.description: While conduits on their own are already awesome, you can also hide them if you want. There are 2 types of facades, basic and hardened. While basic ones are simple and easy, the reinforced ones are able to withstand explosions and mining with tools. You have to use your Yeta Wrench to remove it

questDatabase.name: Come to the dark side...
questDatabase.description: ...we have cookies

questDatabase.name: Luke, I am your father!
questDatabase.description: With that dark steel you got, you may now craft yourself a new set of armor. While pretty basic first, it can be upgraded later to unlock powerful features

questDatabase.name: Dark (murky) tools
questDatabase.description: There are also tools made of dark steel. Each of them can receive upgrades; Hold shift to get the tooltip which will explain what you need in order to upgrade them.

questDatabase.name: Still more upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade your armor and tools, you not only need 10 Levels each, but also 8 Vibrant crystals

questDatabase.name: Tea, please?
questDatabase.description: This machine is not only capable of brewing more powerful burnable liquids, it can also be used to brew nutrient distillation, which might have a further usage soon

questDatabase.name: Smelting alloys
questDatabase.description: You're STILL looking for a description? -.-

questDatabase.name: Crafted automating or Automated crafting?
questDatabase.description: Well, buzzard's gutts, man! You STILL need to be reminded of these things?

questDatabase.name: Ore processing
questDatabase.description: Like, really? -.-

questDatabase.name: Torture device
questDatabase.description: Just get to work

questDatabase.name: Rocket fuel.. NOT rocket science
questDatabase.description: It claims to be rocket fuel, but it isn't. However, it does generate quite a bit of power. Use your "Vat" to make some. Will generate 160 RF/t when used in a combustion generator

questDatabase.name: Tasty...
questDatabase.description: Yeah, that is... Well.. You are sure it will have an usage for something.. some day...

questDatabase.name: Firewater! Wait... wut? ._.
questDatabase.description: Not exaclty what you think it is; It's better to not consume that liquid. When used in the combustion generator, it will produce 80RF/t

questDatabase.name: Hootch? Sounds more like smoo..oops!
questDatabase.description: The lowest tier of renewable, burnable fluid. Generates 60 RF/t, but can be automated for "green" infinite power

questDatabase.name: Automated Mob-Farming
questDatabase.description: Of course... A zombie loves that ... disgusting liquid. While using a small amount per hit, he will attack everything that is within his range. That also includes players, so be careful. Rumors are, that there might be a weapon that will never break when used in this "machine"...

questDatabase.name: And they said it shall never break
questDatabase.description: By using an etheric sword, your KillerJoe will run.. forever. Proper enchantments are a requirement for be efficient, but that shouldn't be a problem

questDatabase.name: Simple item transfer
questDatabase.description: Translocators can only transfer items over a distance of 1 block. But they're quite cheap, and a good solution to build compact machines

questDatabase.name: Simple fluid transfer
questDatabase.description: Just like the item translocators, the fluid ones transfer.. fluids. Same restrictions apply; 1 Block distance

questDatabase.name: Harder, stronger, faster
questDatabase.description: No, actually not faster. But more durable than Tier 1.

questDatabase.name: Turrect your base; v2.0
questDatabase.description: Slightly better protection; And now with a real gun. Shots will be fired for real now!

questDatabase.name: TTT Tier 2 Turret base
questDatabase.description: Nothing to see here. Proceed

questDatabase.name: Someone gotta bite the bullet
questDatabase.description: They hit hard. You have been warned

questDatabase.name: Burn 'em one and burn 'em all!
questDatabase.description: Hmmm, crispy bacon. What would happen if you enable neutral mobs as target..?

questDatabase.name: Tier 4
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Paying the highest sacrifice
questDatabase.description: When arcane magic just isn't enough to satiate your thirst, you need something.. stronger; Which is bonded with blood, perhaps... Your blood, and maybe others', too...

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Moon
questDatabase.description: As Buzzzz Aldrin was overheard saying, ' I was the second man on moon. Neil before me!' Anyways, rhetorics apart, HV is the age where you should focus on reaching the moon, as soon as possible. You need titanium in large quantities

questDatabase.name: Am I omnipresent?
questDatabase.description: The inventory panel is an alternative to your (hopefully?) existing ProjectRed storage system. Just like project red, you have to connect every chest/barrel with an item conduit. In addition to that, you also have to install a "remote awareness" upgrade into every (!) conduit you want the panel to see

questDatabase.name: Batteries... Portable? Should be?!
questDatabase.description: Not exactly a "battery", more a portable access point for your lifepoints, aka blood.

questDatabase.name: Shinigami (Looking at you, Japanese peeps!)
questDatabase.description: Wouldn't it be great to actually make use of the intelligence or innate abilities a creature has? For example; The ender-teleportation? Or use the brain capacity of a zombie for simple logic? (He doesn't use it anyways...) With this machine, you are able to bind a captured soul to an item, which can then be used in machines to improve their functionality

questDatabase.name: Yet another all(o)y
questDatabase.description: There are some... "Darker" uses for machines. Stuff that might be considered "Magic". Anyways, for that you need a new alloy; Soularium

questDatabase.name: Experience-Storage
questDatabase.description: Dying is painful, isn't it? As your precious experience is lost. But fear not, there is a solution! By using an experience obelisk, you are now able to save up all your hard-earned experience somewhere (safe?)

questDatabase.name: A soul vassal
questDatabase.description: For your new machine, you need something to actually capture souls from monsters. The soul vials are reusable vessels; Just right-click any living entity to steal its soul.

questDatabase.name: The (re?)creation of life
questDatabase.description: By utilizing large amounts of energy, you're able to re-activate those broken spawners you may have found and broken in the past. If you haven't, you should get one now

questDatabase.name: I want this, but don't want that
questDatabase.description: Enchanting books is, just as it is for items, random. And that is annoying if you need a specific enchantment on your tool or armor. Now there is a way to actually select enchantments, for a price, obviously.

questDatabase.name: Feels LIKE steel
questDatabase.description: Next-gen protection against nasty Zombies, creepers and other "stuff"

questDatabase.name: Booms and Bangs; Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Now we're talking (with firearms, of course); Grenades! Cannons! Big booms.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 base
questDatabase.description: More storage, more power, and a lot more slots for possible upgrades. Keep upgrading...

questDatabase.name: This is relatively useful
questDatabase.description: For... some things... mabye... At least it is fun to watch

questDatabase.name: Fire in the hole!
questDatabase.description: Ah, there is nothing like an explosion and the certitude that your enemies have been blasted to pieces

questDatabase.name: Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The main goal here is to get a Tier 2 rocket, and reach Mars. You also might want to rethink your power setup, as more and more machines will be upgraded. This questset will teach you about a couple of options you have regarding power production.

questDatabase.name: Pokeyman! (Looks at you Pikachu fans!)
questDatabase.description: Time to get some blood. You have to start with your own...

questDatabase.name: It's storage time. Wait.. Again already?
questDatabase.description: Now that you've reached HighVoltage age, you might consider starting to work on your AE System. It might be small, and it might be tricky to power it at first, but it's really worth the effort. You should start by collecting all 4 inscriber patterns

questDatabase.name: Find 'em all
questDatabase.description: There are a lot of asteroids on the surface, but there are more; Underground. In order to find those, you need a compass. This quest is optional

questDatabase.name: Driving Drives
questDatabase.description: Quite different from anything you've seen before. Make sure to check out the Item/Fluid processors!

questDatabase.name: Those darned crystals
questDatabase.description: Not "flux"; Even if the color is the same

questDatabase.name: Autocrafting... actually!
questDatabase.description: Crafting can be a pain. So why not automate it?

questDatabase.name: Circuits or Sir, kits?
questDatabase.description: Making the circuits is quite different from what you're used to, so it's advised to check NEI for the new recipes. Get 8 of each circuit for now

questDatabase.name: More hooking ups
questDatabase.description: To have access to your AE across your base, you'll need cables. Maybe evn scores of them. For now, the basic ones will do, but eventually, you'll want to use dense cables and P2P Channels

questDatabase.name: Terminals everywhere!
questDatabase.description: And a pain to craft, no doubt

questDatabase.name: Can you get there in your first attempt?
questDatabase.description: Reach Mars

questDatabase.name: Phobic of Phobos, eh?
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet

questDatabase.name: Dim Goal: Deimos
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet

questDatabase.name: HEV Mk III Protective System
questDatabase.description: Some things are dirty, and some things are even dangerous. You'll play with nasty stuff here, so better prepare yourself

questDatabase.name: Excited neutrons!
questDatabase.description: Whether you used Magic, Steam, Oil or Biogas for power until now, you'll run into problems as you advance to higher tiers. So you need to upgrade your power grid; At least for your blast furnaces. So let's start with something more powerful: A nuclear reactor

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 fuel: Uranium
questDatabase.description: Just "regular" uranium fuel, nothing special about it

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 fuel: MOX
questDatabase.description: Acronym for Mixed Oxides. Highly reactive, but the most powerful fuel rod you can get. Burns twice as fast as uranium, but produces massive amounts of power. Rumors are, that peaks up to 11k EU/t are possible...

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 fuel: Thor-ium
questDatabase.description: The weakest of all rods, but very easy to produce, very easy to keep cool and runs twice as long as uranium. A perfect "fire and forget" power source

questDatabase.name: Monitoring your reactor... or reactions...
questDatabase.description: It's important to monitor your reactor (Or just fancy to have a big screen somewhere...) So now that you've gained knowledge about the available fuel rods, you can start to build yourself a power plant. Here is something to help you out

questDatabase.name: Capacity upgrade!
questDatabase.description: To unleash the full potential of your reactor, you have to attach 6 reactor chambers to it

questDatabase.name: Beat the heat!
questDatabase.description: Reactors heat up, well the rods do, so you need to "beat the heat " to somewhere else. You should get one of each, and try to figure out what each individual heat exchanger does, in order to figure out a good setup

questDatabase.name: Venting out
questDatabase.description: You can't just move the heat around; Eventually you need to get rid of it. Just like the exchangers, there are different types of vents, each of them has a certain usage you'll need to find out

questDatabase.name: Double the excitement
questDatabase.description: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot

questDatabase.name: Quit Exhaling Dusts
questDatabase.description: The QED is used for stuffs like EnderQuarry (yay) and advanced mob-protection

questDatabase.name: Xtended mob-protection
questDatabase.description: Like the chandelier, the magnum torch prevents monsters from spawning. However, its range is 128 blocks, so a single one might be enough for your entire base

questDatabase.name: Autommmining
questDatabase.description: The QED enables you to assemble the most convenient device ever for mining: The EnderQuarry

questDatabase.name: Hit the gas pedal!
questDatabase.description: A normal Quarry won't satisfy your needs for MOOOOORE, so a speed upgrade is required

questDatabase.name: Bundled or jumbled?
questDatabase.description: P2P tunnels. You need them; A lot of them!

questDatabase.name: Load, Launch, Unload
questDatabase.description: Of what use is an automated rocket, if you can't automatically load and unload it?

questDatabase.name: Cargo rocket; For the fun
questDatabase.description: No need to fly to distant planets anymore on your own to grab mined ores

questDatabase.name: Turning A into B using C
questDatabase.description: Molecular transforming all the things! The most important recipe here is sunnarium

questDatabase.name: Turret base Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Even more range, power and upgrade slots

questDatabase.name: Turrect your base; Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Parts for powerful turrets

questDatabase.name: Make love, not war
questDatabase.description: For those who don't want to kill things; Just teleport them away. Though love is rarely free these days... You gotta pay a 'power'ful price...

questDatabase.name: Why lasers ...
questDatabase.description: ...when you can use rockets? Yes, Rockets! They search and destroy, and go off with a huge pomp

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 Fence your fort
questDatabase.description: Another upgrade for you walls. One more to go

questDatabase.name: Pulverize the moon
questDatabase.description: Literally. You can grind the rock of most planets, to get a chance for higher tier metal dusts. Does consume quite a bit of power, but can really help you out at times

questDatabase.name: Tier 6
questDatabase.description: IV-Level. You will need Tungstensteel for machines. Supposed Planets to visit: Mars, Phobos, Deimos. You should've learned "How to Gregtech" by now.

questDatabase.name: The beginning of.. the end.... ?
questDatabase.description: Basically the "end" of the conventional tiered gameplay. However! This is just the start of your journey, as you'll have access to even more powerful and awesome stuff. You have proven yourself worthy, and mastered the challenges up to this Tier; Congratulations!

questDatabase.name: On your way to Tier 7
questDatabase.description: The next Tier is defined as "Asteroids-Dimension" and "8192 EU/t Machines". The machines now reach their full potential, and some asteroids may contain precious ores to improve your powergen

questDatabase.name: "Clean" energy..?
questDatabase.description: Finally, a reliable and powerful source of energy for your base. And why waste your time with a 2k generator? Go for a 8k one! (Hint: It's probably a good idea to wear your hazmat suite before claiming your reward...)

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Void
questDatabase.description: Tired of mobs in your base? Want to build somewhere.. Different? Probably in a void Dimension? Then this is your chance. But choose wisely; You can only pick one option

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Loot
questDatabase.description: Don't need a void dim, eh? Well, then you'll probably be happy about some extra loot. Choose wisely; You can only pick one

questDatabase.name: Almost unbreakable
questDatabase.description: Probably not required anymore, but you made so many walls, so why not make some Tier5?

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 5
questDatabase.description: Tough materials, for tough weapons. Railguns, and lasers, and.. stuff. I assume you want a lot of those soon

questDatabase.name: Fortifying your base... Turrecting Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The last one, I promise. Used for the most powerful turrets available. You wonder if they might help you take out some more... "Dangerous" enemies..?

questDatabase.name: Bazinga!
questDatabase.description: Requires no ammo, but still does a ton of damage. All you need to do is feed it power

questDatabase.name: EMP/Railguns, what else
questDatabase.description: Massive power, and a wonderful sound when they fire. I recommend to use upgrades to increase range and damage

questDatabase.name: Strange things
questDatabase.description: You came across those weird trees, they seem to be more than just plants. You felt something... Different. There is something going on, but you are not sure what exactly yet. But you're sure you'll find out very soon

questDatabase.name: Searching for answers
questDatabase.description: Last night, you had a dream. A Dimension, so weird and different, exactly like the sappling you found. You decided to go there and look for answers.

questDatabase.name: Seeing the unseen
questDatabase.description: Everything is made of 6 primal aspects. Those aspects can be combined to form compound aspects, but in the end, there are only 6. Like the infused shards you found. You noticed that those shards start to vibrate when you bring them next to something that is made of the respective aspect. Maybe you can create a device to actually "scan" items, and reveal their compounds? This could be very usefull later on

questDatabase.name: Turning tables
questDatabase.description: The idea with the bookshelf did indeed work! Now you need a nice table to do some research on, and probably something to infuse items with vis while crafting. Maybe you should try to hit a table with your wand

questDatabase.name: Infinite Water
questDatabase.description: By sacrificing some blood to the water spirits, they'll grant you some of their precious element

questDatabase.name: Magic stones
questDatabase.description: This whole place here is filled with magic. No matter where you look at, it's just everywhere. You wonder what happens to normal stone if it is exposed to large amounts of magic for a long time. Maybe it's time to go mining?

questDatabase.name: Your first wand
questDatabase.description: You are sure that this place will give you all the answers you are looking for! To continue, you need something to handle the magic energy called "Vis". Guess it's time to craft your first wand

questDatabase.name: Tome of knowledge
questDatabase.description: All the things you've discovered so far, you need to write them down. But you are lazy, and you have a wand, so why not try a magical way to "write down" your researches? You wonder if you could enchant a book with your wand, so that it will keep track of your progress... You should try that on a bookself!

questDatabase.name: Improving your wand
questDatabase.description: Your wand does a great job in storing and releasing vis as you please. However, those iron caps are.. Weak. If you don't pay enough attention to them, they might hurt the node. Maybe you should try to improve it with caps made out of a more valuable material. Like.. Gold, maybe?

questDatabase.name: shhhh... shards
questDatabase.description: Now that you found all 6 primal types of magic infused stone, you need to break those up in order to get the shards. The easiest way to do that, is to throw these stones in your forge hammer.

questDatabase.name: A "greater" Wand
questDatabase.description: While doing all your research and mining these infused stones, you had an idea how to actually use the Wood of an Greatwood tree to make a new wand. Actually, it turned out to be pretty simple, but you lacked one important thing back then: Vis!. The vis makes sure the wood doesn't loose it's magic conductivity while forming the rod

questDatabase.name: Screw you!
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, your aluminium screws don't work with the greatwood rod. Somehow, the wood seems to repell the material. Luckily, you already have a blast furnace, so you can get a better material than aluminium

questDatabase.name: A more powerfull "scale"
questDatabase.description: The naga scales are weak, they can only hold a very limited amount of Vis. You need a better, more powerfull component to store Vis in your wand. You've heard rumors about an evil Wizard in the Twilight forest. Maybe he has ...something... that can be used..?

questDatabase.name: "Stores 50 Vis" Wand
questDatabase.description: Now combine your new wand, and be more powerfull than before! You have a feeling, that this new wand will become handy very soon

questDatabase.name: Fuuuuuu..sion!
questDatabase.description: Your arcane table does a great job with infusing primal vis into items while crafting. However, you feel that there must be more. What if you could infuse items with all kinds of magical aspects? The possibilities are endless

questDatabase.name: Another brick in the wall
questDatabase.description: A magic one. You are on your way to infusion, and you need 8 of those in total

questDatabase.name: Cooking (or smelting?) Essentia
questDatabase.description: In order to get essentia, you need to dissolve items. Obviously, you only want to dissolve those items you don't really need, and only those, for the essentia you need to craft things

questDatabase.name: Not for soup
questDatabase.description: At least not for edible soup, but for essentia slurry. Get yourself a Cauldron and give it a whack with your wand

questDatabase.name: Balancing the unbalanced
questDatabase.description: By combining all 6 primal aspects in a crucible, you are able to make balanced shards. They can be ground up into Salis Mundus, an absolutely crucial thing to have, trust me!

questDatabase.name: Crystal clusters
questDatabase.description: You, as a Thaumaturge, like shiny things. And what could be more shiny than a cluster made of those shards? You totally should get one of each

questDatabase.name: The choice: Ignis
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: The choice
questDatabase.description: By now, you should've collected a few (or a lot) of locations for Aura nodes to get Vis from. You  might also have noticed, that you probably are low on a certain aspect, like Aer. Or Ignis. Well, good news. In exchange for some crystal clusters, I will give you one of my old nodes. They are all pale, but they will help you out. You may only choose one, so think twice before you make your decision

questDatabase.name: The choice: Terra
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: The choice: Perditio
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: The choice: Ordo
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: The choice: Aqua
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: The choice: Aer
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore: Second hand. But who cares?
display.Name: Used Auranode

questDatabase.name: Not just for aesthetics
questDatabase.description: Sure, they look pretty, but they serve a much more important purpose: Channeling vast amounts of Vis and essentia. This might be usefull soon

questDatabase.name: This is the end...
questDatabase.description: ...of your apprenticeship. You have mastered all 6 primal aspects, you mastered the weak and strong infusion of essentia and vis, and you've already made your adept wand. But be warned, young one. The further you progress, the more darkness, and evil will tempt you to follow the forbidden ways of magic. I have seen things... Weather changing, random teleportation, or even a Wither spawning right next to someone. Be careful, my friend

questDatabase.name: Turning liquids into essentia
questDatabase.description: What a simple idea. So many people wasted tons of buckets just to get Aqua from Water, or Sano from Milk. Why didn't they just dissolve the liquid itself? Stupid ones...

questDatabase.name: Essentia filtering
questDatabase.description: This nifty little device will filter out essentia. Once it has received a single unit of any type, it will only accept this type until it is completely empty. How convenient. You can place more than one on top of an alchemical furnace

questDatabase.name: An alternative to torches
questDatabase.description: And lava! It's an excellent heat source

questDatabase.name: Not coal
questDatabase.description: Way better. To be fair, it's a waste to use coal itself, but it also works with charcoal. And it speeds up the dissolving of items in an alchemical furnace

questDatabase.name: Save the squids, we must
questDatabase.description: A very convenient way to make PETA activists happy and get ink at the same time. (Hint: The essentia in those roses might be useful...)

questDatabase.name: Infinite.. Lava?
questDatabase.description: Well, it does need some Ignis vis, but hey, it's free

questDatabase.name: Infinite water!
questDatabase.description: The struggle is over. You finally discovered a way to get infinite amounts of water.

questDatabase.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questDatabase.description: I have mastered the basics. Master warned me about forbidden magic, but it sounds so promising. I think a bit of forbidden stuff can't hurt...

questDatabase.name: An awesome magic conductor
questDatabase.description: These tears, wow, I've never felt something so strong. Could it be? Could I use those to actually finallize my Silverwood wand?

questDatabase.name: An even better conductor?
questDatabase.description: More... I want mooore! There must be something even stronger than the Hydra. Something older, more ancient.

questDatabase.name: It doesn't work
questDatabase.description: I tried to combine the lich bones I had with this new wand rod. The result: A pile of ashes. It crumbled to dust within seconds. I need a better conductor. The hydra in the twilight forest has the ability to regrow an entire head! Her blood must contain a large amount of magic. I guess I need a bit of that for my next wand

Lore: It crumbled to dust within seconds...
display.Name: Lich Bone

questDatabase.name: Obsidian Rod
questDatabase.description: By using Obsidian and some earth clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Terra vis

questDatabase.name: Creating a better wand
questDatabase.description: This greatwood wand is nice, but it can only store 50 Vis. Not enough to move nodes. My tries to use Silverwood failed, but I've come across other mundane materials that I could use to make a new wand core.

questDatabase.name: More durable screws
questDatabase.description: Those stainless steel screws don't work on these rods. Due to the huge amounts of Vis those wands can carry, the screws "melt" away, somehow. I need a more durable material. I guess I will try titanium

Lore: It.. melted..?!
display.Name: Stainless Steel screw

questDatabase.name: Quartz rod
questDatabase.description: By using nether quartz and some ordo clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ordo vis

questDatabase.name: Reed rod
questDatabase.description: By using sugar cane and some air clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Air vis

questDatabase.name: Blazing rod
questDatabase.description: By using a blaze rod and some fire clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ignis vis

questDatabase.name: Icy rod
questDatabase.description: By using hardend ice and some aqua clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Aqua vis

questDatabase.name: Bone rod
questDatabase.description: Forbidden? Pah. I don't care about headaches. By using Bone and entropy clusters, I'm able to create an infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own perditio vis

questDatabase.name: Best wand caps ever
questDatabase.description: Of course! Thaumium! What could conduct Vis better than... A magic metal?

questDatabase.name: She let go
questDatabase.description: This blood seems pretty common, but she had advanced magic abilities. I'm sure I can use this as a conductor

questDatabase.name: Reactor material
questDatabase.description: This stuff is interesting... Maybe I can use it as wand conductor?

questDatabase.name: Centi-Vis
questDatabase.description: Many advanced machines require Vis in order to do what they're supposed to; But using a wand as some sort of battery to transfer Vis from a Node to your machine didn't work as expected. What if you could rip open a node?

questDatabase.name: Bring it home
questDatabase.description: You probably have a nice collection of bookmarked nodes. But running around to recharge your wand(s) isn't really the way an adept thaumaturge should get his required vis. Moving nodes is not that hard, but without doubt, you need something to protect them from each other

questDatabase.name: Automated wand-recharge
questDatabase.description: So you found a way to gather nodes now. What about automated wand recharge? Wouldn't that be extremely convenient?

questDatabase.name: CentiVis stuff
questDatabase.description: You totally should get yourself some CentiVis things to transport and use the Vis from stabilized nodes

questDatabase.name: The dark realm
questDatabase.description: We found the way my precious. We found it! Only need 4 tasty eyes, and some magic to open the door. The secret door, they didn't see it; Hehehe; All the time. It was there... Aaaall the time!

questDatabase.name: They see me, they watch me
questDatabase.description: Eyes. Yes. Eyes! I need eyes, my precious. Not spidery ones, no. Nasty hairy things. Don't taste good. Eldritch eyes! I will rip those from their bodies.

questDatabase.name: Really (really!) dark magic
questDatabase.description: Fools. FOOLS I say! They know nothing! This book will guide me, yes. Yes it will, my precious. It will lead us to even more power

questDatabase.name: Secrets
questDatabase.description: I can feel it. Yess. Yeeeess. We will gain more power soon. Soon! Yes. My precious. The voices gave me a hint, there is a dimension filled with unbelievable sources of magic energy. I must go there. I must! The Crimson people know the secret. I will rip them aparrrt.. They will tell me

questDatabase.name: Find the key
questDatabase.description: No, nooo! They have hidden it! Must find the keeey. Must find it! We need the tablet to open the door my precious.

questDatabase.name: The power of creation
questDatabase.description: What.. What am I doing here? Where am I?! What is this place?! Oh those headaches... (It seems that the pulsating pearl you just found cured your brain from.. something. Something old, probably some kind of trap to keep away unworthy ones)

questDatabase.name: Concentrated darkness
questDatabase.description: For some reason, you decided to infuse darkness into a seed. It appeared to be promising. For what? You don't know...

questDatabase.name: "Armor"
questDatabase.description: This new metal, it's so.. appealing. You feel comfortable while holding it, so why not get yourself some armor? What could go wrong? It sure will protect you

questDatabase.name: What could possibly go wrong?
questDatabase.description: 256 Essentia in one block! Now that is what I call storage. Does make weird sounds, but I guess it's just normal

questDatabase.name: Let's try this
questDatabase.description: Mortals. Pah. What do they know about REAL power. The voices tell me I need to focus on Alienis and Tenebrae if I want to advance. So what about food?

questDatabase.name: An appropriate weapon
questDatabase.description: My new armor needs an appropriate weapon to go along with. I should make something to fire creates of the nether at enemies!

questDatabase.name: Improved Armor; Ninja Style
questDatabase.description: Time to get some decent armor; With this, those infernal monsters won't be as much of a pain as they are now

questDatabase.name: Little helpers
questDatabase.description: A state of the art thaumaturge doesn't work anymore. He has little helpers. Golems can and will do all the things for you, just as you command them

questDatabase.name: Slightly better
questDatabase.description: Wood is somewhat better than straw. They are still to be considered weak, but an ideal little cutie for farms

questDatabase.name: Sticks and stones
questDatabase.description: will break your bones! These guys are hard as rock (Insert audience laugh here) and will protect your claim as good as possible

questDatabase.name: The best of all
questDatabase.description: Highly durable, can carry a lot of items and is to be considered the "top tier" golem. But you are sure there is more...

questDatabase.name: Essentia storage
questDatabase.description: Sure, you could just go with gazillions of jars, but it's way more convenient to store essentia in a chest or barrel. Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: The basic elements
questDatabase.description: Of course you know where and how to get the basic essentia types. Do you..?

questDatabase.name: Essentia transmission
questDatabase.description: What if.. you could send essentia from a different location to your infusion matrix? You could finally get rid of all those jars around your altar. Also, there might be an additional use for those mirrors

questDatabase.name: (Almost) automated essentia
questDatabase.description: By combining the essentia locus, the essentia mirror and an essentia aggregator, you are now able to transmit essentia from almost anywhere. Fancy essentia-storage facility incomming!

questDatabase.name: Essentia Monitoring
questDatabase.description: Manually checking your jars can be tedious, especially if you want to infuse a bunch of stuff at once. Luckily, the Essentia Locus can help you with that, as it monitors all jars that have been targeted with a crystalline eye

questDatabase.name: Cleaning the goo
questDatabase.description: As you're doing more and more infusions, you're probably tired of removing all the flux that's generated from time to time. The shovel of the purifier will help you with that task, and is a must-have

questDatabase.name: One does not simply...
questDatabase.description: ...play with magic. Be warned, those fires are dangerous to use. But who doesn't want a patch of snow in the nether?

questDatabase.name: Useful plant life
questDatabase.description: While regular plants are basically just used to make food, you wondered if you could get some.. "more special" plant life going...

questDatabase.name: Pushing the limits
questDatabase.description: Regular enchantments do have a limit, like III for Fortune. By utilizing magic, you should be able to bypass that limitation, at least a tiny bit; Eventually creating enchantments like Fortune IV. It comes with limitations, but your book shall tell you more about those

questDatabase.name: Enchanting like a pro
questDatabase.description: Finally, a device where you can actually choose which enchantment you want to have. Powered by vis, it can create the most powerful combinations one could imagine

questDatabase.name: Crying obsidian
questDatabase.description: Quite confusing name, but this might come in handy for some cases. By placing 2 on top of each other, you're able to set your respawn point to that location, without the need for a bed. It's up to you to imagine the possibilities...

questDatabase.name: Useful trees
questDatabase.description: Just like plants, there are trees that will attract various friendly and "not so friendly" creatures.

questDatabase.name: The power of gods
questDatabase.description: The pearl you've found has some interesting effects on you. Not only the voices are almost gone, also somehow your perception has expanded. You can "feel" the magic around you. This is definitely worth some further investigation

questDatabase.name: Zero Point Module
questDatabase.description: Thanks to your help, I managed to create the ultimate Energy Source: An encased wormhole. I have no use for it, so you may have it. Thank you for letting my dream come true!

questDatabase.name: Shards of opposite worlds
questDatabase.description: This morning, you just wanted to facepalm yourself to death. On your past journeys, you already saw strange colored shards. But unlike the primal shards you use every day, these seem to contain the raw essence of their dimension. The Hell and .. Heaven, so to say. Two opposite worlds

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable cowl
questDatabase.description: It will never break; How convenient

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable leggings
questDatabase.description: It will never break; How convenient

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable robe
questDatabase.description: It will never break; How convenient

questDatabase.name: Infused cloth
questDatabase.description: By combining ichor with enchanted fabric, you've created something that could be compared to mithril. Light as wool, but durable like steel. Also, it conducts magic energy like nothing else you've seen before. This seems to be an excellent material for a new armor

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable boots
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable axe
questDatabase.description: A axe made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Infused Thaumium
questDatabase.description: By combining ichor with some thaumium, the metal turned into something new; Something extremely durable but also soft. Its magic conductivity is incredible

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable Sword
questDatabase.description: A sword made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable
questDatabase.description: A pickaxe made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable shovel
questDatabase.description: A shovel made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Hold all the foci
questDatabase.description: Hermione's first years bag

questDatabase.name: Where do the items go?
questDatabase.description: It's better to not ask...

questDatabase.name: Magical waystones
questDatabase.description: These are used to mark target locations in order to teleport around

questDatabase.name: Why walk...
questDatabase.description: ...when you can teleport? This little device allows you to teleport around almost for free. Is it cheaty? Is it OP? Not, it's a celestial gateway!

questDatabase.name: Brewers start
questDatabase.description: In order to get started with your basic witchery needs, you need a witches oven. It's used to get the most basic ingredients for your recipes; The fumes

questDatabase.name: Offerings
questDatabase.description: For all your offering needs. And, of course, it looks fancy!

questDatabase.name: A cauldron
questDatabase.description: The second thing you'll need is a cauldron. It is used to craft most of the basic items, like mutandis

questDatabase.name: Don't touch the needle!
questDatabase.description: While having not many recipes by itself, the few it has are rather important for your further witchery progression

questDatabase.name: Probably usable for soup
questDatabase.description: But its main purpose is to brew potions and infusions

questDatabase.name: Don't shake it too much
questDatabase.description: Unlike nitroglycerin, this stuff doesn't explode. But you still shouldn't shake it too much...

questDatabase.name: Getting basic fumes
questDatabase.description: Fume extraction is an essential thing to do, and you'll need a lot of those on your journey

questDatabase.name: Circle magic
questDatabase.description: For circle magic, you need... a circle; Obviously. There are 4 types of chalk you can use, and you'll need all of them to proceed

questDatabase.name: Portable power source
questDatabase.description: By infusing a stone with fiery magic you may create an 'Attuned Stone'. These stones can be used to link non-magical devices to the magical currents present...

questDatabase.name: Flying OINKment
questDatabase.description: You tried, it doesn't fly. And it also doesn't make any OINK sounds, sadly. But there might be some use for it...

questDatabase.name: Nimbus 1999
questDatabase.description: Not as good as its successor, the 2000'ish model, but still "somehow" useful...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Refined evil
questDatabase.description: Refined good is out of stock, sorry

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Witches hand
questDatabase.description: In case you don't like the infernal witches...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Seeping shoes
questDatabase.description: Who needs an antidote?

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Taglock kits
questDatabase.description: Get a death protection poppet and get a stack of taglock kits. For all your trolling needs

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Drop of luck
questDatabase.description: Hard to get; Even with that quest. But less of a grind...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Cane sword
questDatabase.description: Serves 2 purposes: Style. And.. ah, yeah.. Something useful for vampires

questDatabase.name: Be a vampire; Like a sir
